plugin.name: MLv
plugin.description: Local (Richter) magnitude measured on the vertical component

parameter.name: logA0
parameter.description: Overrides the calibration function log10(A0) for computing MLv per region. See logA0 description in the bindings.

binding.name: MLv
binding.description: Local (Richter) magnitude measured on the vertical component

extend-struct.description: Parameters for measuring MLv amplitudes. Add more parameters by adding an amplitude type profile 'MLv',

parameter.name: minPeriod
parameter.description: No period is measured along with MLv amplitudes and this value should not be changed. Setting a value > 0 will cause failure of MLv amplitude measurements.

parameter.name: maxPeriod
parameter.description: No period is measured along with MLv amplitudes and this value should not be changed. Setting a value > 0 will cause failure of MLv amplitude measurements.

parameter.name: preFilter
parameter.description: The filter applied to raw records before applying Wood-Anderson simulation. Default: no pre-filtering.

parameter.name: applyWoodAnderson
parameter.description: Applying Wood-Anderson simulation. To achieve displacement records without WA simulation, an integration filter can be applied with the pre-filter.

parameter.name: measureType
parameter.description:
Type for measuring amplitudes.
AbsMax: absolute maximum
MinMax: half difference between absolute maximum and minimum
PeakTrough: half difference between maximum and minimum on a half cycle
Note that if absMax is already explicitly configured, this parameter has no effect.

extend-struct.description: Parameters for computing MLv magnitudes from MLv amplitudes.

parameter.name: minPeriod
parameter.description: No period is measured along with MLv amplitudes and this value should not be changed. Setting any value will cause failure of MLv magnitude computation.

parameter.name: maxPeriod
parameter.description: No period is measured along with MLv amplitudes and this value should not be changed. Setting any value will cause failure of MLv magnitude computation.

parameter.name: logA0
parameter.description:
The calibration function log10(A0).
Format: any list of distance-value pairs separated by comma. Values within pairs are separated by colon.
Example: "0:-1.3,60:-2.8,100:-3.0,400:-4.5,1000:-5.85" specifies 4 distance intervals from 0...60, 60...100, 100...400 and 400...1000 km distance. Within these intervals log10(A0) is interpolated linearly between -1.3...-2.8, -2.8...-3.0, -3.0...-4.5 and -4.5...-5.8, respectively.
Note: The first and last distance samples limit the maximum distance range for computing MLv.
